Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for Freshmen and Sophomores
Add Consent: Department Consent Required
Drop Consent: Department Consent Required
title: WCAS ANTHRO 101-6-23 First-Year Seminar

instructors.instructor_addr: Dept of Anthropology 1810 Hinman Room A63

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Recently ideas about the "paleo-lifestyle" have begun to be spread in popular culture, often with prescriptions about how modern humans should conduct their lives in order to achieve better health and well-being. This course will survey some of these "paleo" recommendations and popular conceptions of our ancestors. These popular conceptions will be viewed critically against the evidence for what our ancestors actually did and what, if anything, it means for people living in the modern era. Some of the included topics will include dietary recommendations, exercise/barefoot running, childcare and feeding practices, and pathogen exposure/immune function.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
METHOD OF EVALUATION
Class participation = 100 points (30% of final grade)
Reaction papers = 10 points each (40% of final grade)
Final = 100 points (30% of final grade)

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
READING LIST
A course packet will be put together and distributed through Quartet Copy.

subject: ANTHRO
